column4: Is there a decent automated backup utility for Gnome? I think I will miss Time Machine.
I use pybackpack,it works great here
thanks. Sounds a bit amateur though
typical gnome gui
I just did a Google search, and found several recommendations for Back In Time -- http://backintime.le-web.org/
Oh, nice!
and there's an ubuntu repo too!
have you checked the repos for backin time? I'm seeing it in the karmic repos
nope, not at all. Why do you ask?
are you on karmic?
yes and no. I'm dual-booting to that on a Mac.
I just got a notebook; might put Karmic on there, or maybe try Lucid.
backintime is in the universe repo in karmic
That's much better than pybackpack
I know Lucid is not completely stable yet. But maybe stable enough. Have you tried it?
Nope, I don't run anything until it's released
perhaps it's best to go that route. Just didn't want to install Karmic then upgrade so soon after.
Good point, you might wait until Lucid is released, I think it's only a few weeks
don't think I want to keep the notebook sitting there for a month and a half either though (Lucid release is scheduled for 4/29).
you can always throw karmic on it now and upgrade later, up to you
thinking about it. I hope suspend/resume works ok on it. It does on my netbook, but does not on my Mac Mini.
